results.title: The Stress mess
results.creator_credit: Barr Films, Ron Underwood and Mark Chodzko
results.brief_description: This humorous yet hard hitting film follows the Wilson family - Fred, Stacey and their college student daughter, Karen - through a typical stress filled day. The program teaches the importance of setting priorities, delegating tasks, learning to say “No”, and learning how to relax.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barr Films, Ron Underwood and Mark Chodzko

results.title: The Stress Factor/ a Crime Called Violence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Breakthrough series”.
In “The Stress Factor” Andrew Denton and his teenage laboratory technicians identify and examine stress, its causes and effects along with methods of dealing with it. Andrew Denton and a panel of teenagers discuss the perpetrators and victims in “A Crime Called Violence”. Methods of coping with violence inflicted by peers and the reason behind their aggression are discussed by the group from their first hand experiences.

results.title: The Streets of Saigon
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Michael Rubbo
results.brief_description: This is a “social study” in the true sense, filmed in the streets of Saigon while the Vietnamese war was still going strong. Life went on fairly normally except for the noticeable presence of the military, and the number of children, orphaned, homeless, thrown on their own resources to make a living in the streets. It is these children who are in the forefront of the film, along with some American volunteers who tried to help them. Includes the work of Stephen Erhart with the children.

results.title: The Street
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover, Wolf Koenig and Caroline Leaf
results.brief_description: This award-winning animated film spares no feelings, minces no words. A poignant interpretation of a short story from Montreal author Mordecai Richler’s ‘The Street’, it makes what is sometimes an embarrassingly frank statement about how many families respond to their old and infirm members. In soft simple washes of watercolour and ink, the filmmaker interprets reactions to a dying grandmother, capturing family feelings and distilling them into harsh reality. Awards: Twenty-two including Oscar nomination, Hollywood; Toronto; Los Angeles; Melbourne. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: The Stream of life
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”
Designed for 11 to 14 year olds, the film illustrates the bloodstream and its functions, using resources not available in the classroom or school laboratory. Uses clinical techniques, anatomical models and preparations selected to demonstrate body functions.

results.title: The Strawberry blonde
results.creator_credit: William Cagney, Warner Bros Pictures and Raoul Walsh
results.brief_description: We know a few things about Biff Grimes (James Cagney) - he’s married to Amy (Olivia De Havilland), he’s a dentist, he often comes off second best, and he is a one time convict with a short fuse. One Sunday afternoon (the name of the play on which the film is based), a gentleman (Jack Carson) turns up to have his tooth extracted, this sparks an adverse reaction in Grimes, triggering a flashback sequence in which it is revealed that the patient was responsible for sending Grimes to jail, but more painfully that he stole Biff’s girlfriend, Virginia Brush (Rita Hayworth), the eponymous strawberry blonde. As Biff relives the events of years gone by he is forced to re-evaluate his marriage to Amy, a suffragette and best friend of Virginia, and makes a startling discovery. Cast also includes Alan Hale and George Tobias.

results.title: The Stratford adventure
results.creator_credit: Guy Glover, ONF | NFB and Morten Parker
results.brief_description: How a small Canadian city, bearing the name of Stratford and by a river Avon, realized the vision of one of its sons: the creation of a theatre for the staging of the finest Shakespearean drama. The film tells how the idea grew, how a famous British director, Tyrone Guthrie, internationally known stars, Alec Guiness and Irene Worth, and Canadian talent were recruited, and how the Stratford Shakespearean Festival finally became a triumphant reality. (Awards: eight, including Edinburgh; Johannesburg; Oscar nomination, Hollywood)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Guy Glover, ONF | NFB and Morten Parker

results.title: The Stranger = Agantuk
results.creator_credit: National Film Development Corporation of India, Studio Canal+, Erato FIlms, OD Productions and Satyajit Ray
results.brief_description: Agantuk (The Stranger)” was Satyajit Ray’s last film, and one in which he broke his tradition of filming in black and white to shoot in colour for the first time. Anila, a middle class woman living comfortably in Calcutta with her husband and young son, receives a letter from a person claiming to be her long lost uncle, and who wishes to re-establish contact with his family after travelling the world for the past 35 years. Anila’s husband, Sudhindra, suspects that the uncle may be a con-man and a thief, out to infiltrate their household in order to claim an old inheritance, and Anila is torn between this suspicion and her sense of family hospitality and obligation. A week long trial visit is agreed upon so that the true identity of Manmohan can be verified and the stranger moves into their house. He quickly befriends their young son with gifts and stories, then sets about the more difficult task of establishing his credibility to the family and their invited friends who set out to test him. As he explains his wanderlust and his lifelong interest in studying - what makes a particular culture “civilised” during his travels, those in his company begin to fall under his spell. The irony of his accounts of being welcomed into “primitive” societies, while his own family, living in a comfortable urban setting, hold him at arms length is not lost. Through the process the family is drawn to re-examining its values in this light. Cast includes Deepankar De, Mamata Shankar, Bikram Bannerjee and Utpal Dutt. In Bengali with English subtitles.

results.title: The Stranger
results.brief_description: An escaped Nazi criminal marries an American woman and settles in a Connecticut village. A highly convincing melodrama - enhanced by directorial touches, splendid photography and no-holds barred climax, involving a church clock.
results.description: An escaped Nazi criminal marries an American woman and settles in a Connecticut village. A highly convincing melodrama - enhanced by directorial touches, splendid photography and no-holds barred climax, involving a church clock.
